segment.source: Data protection
segment.target: Data protection

segment.source: This article explains how to use the DataProtectionProvider class in the Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.
segment.target: This article explains how to use the DataProtectionProvider class in the Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.

segment.source: Data protection
segment.target: Data protection

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article explains how to use the DataProtectionProvider class in the Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.
segment.target: This article explains how to use the DataProtectionProvider class in the Windows.Security.Cryptography.DataProtection namespace to encrypt and decrypt digital data in a UWP app.

segment.source: You can use the data protection APIs in multiple ways:
segment.target: You can use the data protection APIs in multiple ways:

segment.source: To protect data to an Active Directory (AD) security principal like an AD group.
segment.target: To protect data to an Active Directory (AD) security principal like an AD group.

segment.source: Any member of the group can decrypt the data.
segment.target: Any member of the group can decrypt the data.

segment.source: To protect data to the public key contained in an X.509 certificate.
segment.target: To protect data to the public key contained in an X.509 certificate.

segment.source: The owner of the private key can decrypt the data.
segment.target: The owner of the private key can decrypt the data.

segment.source: To protect data by using a symmetric key.
segment.target: To protect data by using a symmetric key.

segment.source: This works, for example, to protect data to a non-AD principal such as Live ID.
segment.target: This works, for example, to protect data to a non-AD principal such as Live ID.

segment.source: To protect data to the credentials (password) used during logon to a website.
segment.target: To protect data to the credentials (password) used during logon to a website.

segment.source: To protect data, when you create a DataProtectionProvider object you must specify a protection descriptor before calling ProtectAsync or ProtectStreamAsync.
segment.target: To protect data, when you create a DataProtectionProvider object you must specify a protection descriptor before calling ProtectAsync or ProtectStreamAsync.

segment.source: The following example shows possible sample protection descriptors.
segment.target: The following example shows possible sample protection descriptors.

segment.source: Protecting static data
segment.target: Protecting static data

segment.source: The following example shows how to use the ProtectAsync and UnprotectAsync methods to asynchronously protect static data to the current user's SID.
segment.target: The following example shows how to use the ProtectAsync and UnprotectAsync methods to asynchronously protect static data to the current user's SID.

segment.source: Protecting stream data
segment.target: Protecting stream data

segment.source: The following example shows how to use the ProtectStreamAsync and UnprotectStreamAsync methods to asynchronously protect stream data to the current user's SID.
segment.target: The following example shows how to use the ProtectStreamAsync and UnprotectStreamAsync methods to asynchronously protect stream data to the current user's SID.
